revised_title: A 15-Year Study of Rainfall in Charles-Town, South Carolina
tldr: John Lining, a South Carolina physician, presents a 15-year study of rainfall in Charles-Town, South Carolina, from 1738 to 1752. He provides a table of the depth of rain in each year, month, and season, and discusses the impact of clearing land on the local climate. Lining also notes the occurrence of thunderstorms and hurricanes and the driest season ever recorded in the province during the study period.
